sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"舞会"之意。
means: ball ： 多指社交性的舞会，场面较为隆重和正式。
dance ： 指一般性的非正式舞会。

phrase.cizu_name: the ball is in your court

jx.jx_en_mean: it is up to you to make the next move
a person who is full of energy and enthusiasm
the rounded protuberant part of the foot at the base of the big toe
the rounded protuberant part of the hand at the base of the thumb

phrase.cizu_name: have a lot (或 not much) on the ball

jx.jx_en_mean: have a lot of (or not much) ability
maintain the momentum of an activity

phrase.cizu_name: keep one's eye on (或 take one's eye off) the ball

jx.jx_en_mean: keep (or fail to keep) one's attention focused on the matter in hand
jx.jx_cn_mean: 集中（或未能集中）注意力

jx.jx_en_mean: alert to new ideas, methods, and trends
play a ball game such as baseball or cricket

phrase.cizu_name: start (或 get , set) the ball rolling

jx.jx_en_mean: set an activity in motion; make a start

jx.jx_cn_mean: 警惕的，有能力的或有效率的

lj.lj_ly: a teacher who is really on the ball.

jx.jx_en_mean: Relating to qualities, such as competence, skill, or knowledge, that are necessary for success
jx.jx_cn_mean: 成功的必备条件：关于能力、技巧或知识等成功所必要的品质

lj.lj_ly: a manager who has a lot on the ball; a student who has nothing on the ball.
lj.lj_ls: 一个很能干的经理；一名什么也不会的学生

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old Norse bǫllr, of Germanic origin
early 17th cent.: from French bal 'a dance', from late Latin ballare 'to dance'; related to Greek ballizein 'to dance' (also ballein 'to throw')

entry.def: A ball is a round object that is used in games such as tennis, baseball, football, basketball, and cricket.
A ball is something or an amount of something that has a round shape.

example.ex: Thomas screwed the letter up into a ball...
They heard a loud explosion and saw a ball of fire go up.
example.tran: 他们听见一声爆炸的巨响，看见一个火球腾空而起。

entry.def: When you ball something or when it balls, it becomes round.

example.ex: He picked up the sheets of paper, and balled them tightly in his fists...
example.tran: 他抓起那几张纸，在手里紧紧攥成团。

entry.tran: （脚趾和脚相连或拇指和手相连的）球状部位；脚趾球；拇指球
entry.def: The ball of your foot or the ball of your thumb is the rounded part where your toes join your foot or where your thumb joins your hand.
A ball is a large formal social event at which people dance.
A man's balls are his testicles.

entry.tran: 轮到…采取行动（或作出决断）
entry.def: If you say that the ball is in someone's court, you mean that it is his or her responsibility to take the next action or decision in a situation.

example.ex: The ball's now in your court — you have to decide what you're going to do.
example.tran: 轮到你了——你必须决定自己要做什么。

entry.tran: 使某事发生；开始某种活动
entry.def: If you get the ball rolling ,set the ball rolling, or start the ball rolling, you start something happening.

example.ex: He will go to the Middle East next week to get the ball rolling again on peace talks...
example.tran: 他下周将前往中东，开始重启和谈。

example.ex: I just want enough cash to start the ball rolling.
example.tran: 我只是想有足够的启动资金。

entry.def: If you are having a ball, you are having a very enjoyable time.

example.ex: Outside the boys were sitting on the ground and, going by the gales of laughter, they were having a ball.
example.tran: 男孩们在户外席地而坐，从阵阵笑声来看，他们玩得很开心。

entry.def: If you keep several balls in the air, you try to do several different things at once.

example.ex: The detective has to discover the motive, the means and the opportunity and has to keep these three balls in the air.
example.tran: 那名侦探必须查明动机、手段和时机，而且对这三项的调查必须同步展开。

example.ex: ...unhappy mothers trying to juggle ten balls in the air.
example.tran: 同时要做无数件事情的可怜的母亲

entry.def: If someone is on the ball, they are very alert and aware of what is happening.

example.ex: She really is on the ball; she's bought houses at auctions so she knows what she's doing.
example.tran: 她很精明干练；她通过拍卖购过房，所以知道自己在做什么。

entry.def: If someone refuses to play ball, they are unwilling to do what someone wants them to do.

example.ex: The association has threatened to withdraw its support if the banks and building societies refuse to play ball.
example.tran: 该协会威胁说如果银行和建屋互助会不配合的话，它将不再提供支持。

means.word_mean: 1. round object that is hit or thrown or kicked in games;

sentences.sentence: "the ball travelled 90 mph on his serve"
"the mayor threw out the first ball"
"the ball rolled into the corner pocket"

means.word_mean: 2. a solid ball shot by a musket;

sentences.sentence: "they had to carry a ramrod as well as powder and ball"

means.word_mean: 3. an object with a spherical shape;
4. the people assembled at a lavish formal dance;

sentences.sentence: "the ball was already emptying out before the fire alarm sounded"

means.word_mean: 5. one of the two male reproductive glands that produce spermatozoa and secrete androgens;

sentences.sentence: "she kicked him in the balls and got away"

means.word_mean: 6. a spherical object used as a plaything;

sentences.sentence: "he played with his rubber ball in the bathtub"
"a ball of mud caught him on the shoulder"

means.word_mean: 9. a more or less rounded anatomical body or mass; ball of the human foot or ball at the base of the thumb;

sentences.sentence: "he stood on the balls of his feet"

means.word_mean: 10. a ball game played with a bat and ball between two teams of 9 players; teams take turns at bat trying to score run;

sentences.sentence: "there was a baseball game on every empy lot"
"there was a desire for National League ball in the area"

means.word_mean: 11. a pitch that is not in the strike zone;

sentences.sentence: "he threw nine straight balls before the manager yanked him"

means.word_mean: 1. form into a ball by winding or rolling;

list.explanation: 十分难做的事，难得要命的工作

example.en: This job is a real ball-breaker.
The task I got assigned was a ball-buster. for sure.
example.zh: 毫无疑问，指派给我的那项仟务实在太艰巨了。

list.explanation: (监督执行艰巨工作的)残暴的领班、 监工或老板

example.en: The boss is a real ball-breaker, and I don't know how long I can go on with this job.
example.zh: 那老板实在太残暴了，我不知道这工作我还能继续干多久。

example.en: They have special management schools to train ball-breakers.
example.zh: 他们有专门教管理的训练机构，培训监管执行艰巨工作的工头。

list.explanation: (对待男子凶狠的)悍妇，泼妇，"雌老虎"

example.en: Tom told me about that wife of his. A real ball-buster. isn't she?
example.zh: 汤姆把他妻子的事告诉了我。她可真是个泼妇，不是吗？

list.explanation: (儿童玩的一种一摔即响的球形爆竹)摔炮

example.en: The kids had a very nice game ot golf balls.
example.zh: 孩子们玩摔炮玩得很痛快。

stems_affixes.word_buile: ball抛,舞,球+ad表名词→伴随舞蹈的歌谣
ballet芭蕾舞+rina女→ballerina演芭蕾舞的女演员

ball抛,舞,球+ot→来自投票用的小球

Sentence.sentence: Bates College in Maine and Ball State University in Indiana are among other colleges offering three-year options.

sentences.en: When the spun sugar balls,the candy has cooked sufficiently.
sentences.cn: 当棉花糖呈球状时，糖果就够火候了。

jushi.english: He has pitched his ball into our house.
jushi.chinese: 他将球扔进了我们的房子。

jushi.english: His arm is lame from playing ball.
jushi.chinese: 他打过球后一只手臂僵痛。
